ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of multiple infections, surgeries, and current active otorrhea.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive Hearing Loss (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant air-bone gaps and hypocompliant tympanogram consistent with middle ear pathology.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Slight to mild SNHL with a notch at 6 kHz, likely noise or idiopathic origin.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and tympanic membrane compliance.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with asymmetric hearing. The right ear shows slight to mild sensorineural hearing loss with a 6 kHz notch but excellent speech recognition. The left ear exhibits mild sloping to moderately severe conductive hearing loss with significant air-bone gaps, consistent with the history of chronic otitis media and surgeries. Tympanometry confirms middle ear pathology on the left (hypocompliant) and normal function on the right.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight/mild SNHL (PTA 22 dB) with 6 kHz notch. Left ear: Mild sloping to moderately severe conductive loss (PTA 43 dB) with air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 22 dB, WRS 96% at 60 dB HL. Left ear: SRT 45 dB, WRS 96% at 80 dB HL. Excellent discrimination bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (Type A). Left ear: Hypocompliant (Type As), static admittance 0.2 mmho.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral present (500-4000 Hz). Right contralateral, Left ipsilateral, and Left contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Discontinue use of current hearing aid in the left ear to allow infection to clear
Evaluation for Bone Anchored Hearing Aid (BAHA)
counseling_actions: Discussed that the current hearing aid mold may be trapping moisture and contributing to persistent infection
Counseled on the benefits of a BAHA, which bypasses the ear canal and avoids aggravating the infection

escalation.rationale_short: To manage active drainage/infection and evaluate for surgical options (BAHA).

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor resolution of otorrhea and decision regarding BAHA surgery.

expected_outcome: The otorrhea was treated by the ENT specialist.
It was determined that the hearing aid contributed to the persistence of the infection.
The patient is considering surgery for a Bone Anchored Hearing Aid (BAHA).
